Maximillian William Cross }} '''Katie Hopkins''' (born 31 May 1975) is a British [[reality television]] contestant, [[businesswoman]] and [[journalist]], best known for her 2007 appearance on the [[The Apprentice (UK Series Three)|third UK series]] of TV reality programme ''[[The Apprentice (UK)|The Apprentice]]'', in which contestants compete for a £100,000-a-year job working for British [[businessman]] [[Sir Alan Sugar]]. Hopkins withdrew from the programme during the eleventh week. She was memorable on the programme for her controversial comments to other contestants and to the members of the public.{{cite news |url=http://blogs.guardian.co.uk/tv/2007/06/katie_hopkins_should_win_the_apprentice.html |title=Katie Hopkins should win The Apprentice |accessdate=06-16 2007 |publisher=The Stage | location=London | first=Grace | last=Dent | date=2007-06-06}} She has made various media appearances since leaving the programme including taking part in ''[[I'm a Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here! (Series 7 UK)|I'm a Celebrity, Get Me Out of Here!]]'' on ITV.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/6747711.stm |title=Sugar defends interview technique |accessdate=06-16 2007 |publisher=BBC News | date=2007-06-13}} ==Early life== Katie Hopkins was born to Roy and Anona Hopkins in 1975.''Index of Births, Marriages and Deaths in England and Wales, 1837-1983.''{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/pages/live/femail/article.html?in_article_id=458807&in_page_id=1879 |title=So that's why it's called Asset Stripping: the naked ambition of the Apprentice |accessdate=06-14 2007 |authorlink=Richard Price |publisher=Daily Mail | location=London | date=2007-05-31}} As a child she attended a private school and then [[North Devon College]] in [[Barnstaple]]. She attended the [[University of Exeter]], studying [[Politics]] and [[Economics]],; She has participated in Officer Cadet Training at the [[Royal Military Academy Sandhurst]] but did not pass the course as a British Army officer and was deemed to be considered medically unfit to undertake duties.{{cite web |url=http://theinternetforum.co.uk/node/2287 |title=Katie Hopkins |accessdate=06-14 2007 |publisher=The Internet Forum}} She was once a stand-by contestant for reality show ''[[Big Brother (UK)|Big Brother]]''{{cite web |url= http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/realitytv/a59969/apprentice-star-katie-applied-for-big-brother.html |title='Apprentice' star Katie 'applied for Big Brother' |accessdate=06-14 2007 |authorlink=Nick Levine |publisher=Digital Spy}} and appeared in an un-aired [[television pilot]] of the programme.{{cite web |url=http://www.metro.co.uk/fame/article.html?in_article_id=53213&in_page_id=7&in_a_source= |title=Apprentice star Katie was a BB wannabe |accessdate=06-14 2007 |authorlink= |publisher=Metro}} ==Personal life== At University, Hopkins began a romantic relationship with fellow student Alan Hickman which lasted until 2001. Hopkins later left Hickman for her boss, Damien McKinney.{{cite web|url=http://www.sundaymirror.co.uk/news/sunday/tm_method=full%26objectid=18908218%26siteid=98487-name_page.html|title=Cold Katie wrecked two marriages|accessdate=2007-06-14|publisher=Sunday Mirror}} He was a father of three and 15 years her senior. The couple left [[UK|Britain]] to live in [[New York]]; their daughter India was born there in June 2004. They returned to Britain shortly after India's birth and got married the following year. Their second daughter Poppy was born 21 August 2005.{{cite web|url=http://www.newsoftheworld.co.uk/apprentice/news_1006_katie.shtml|title=Katie lashes out at final|accessdate=5 November 2008|publisher=News of the World}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} After filming ''The Apprentice'', Hopkins took up a job at the [[Met Office]] in [[Exeter]].{{cite web |url=http://www.sundaymirror.co.uk/news/sunday/tm_method=full%26objectid=19135255%26siteid=98487-name_page.html|title=Katie and the exes factor|accessdate=06-14 2007|publisher=Sunday Mirror}} Here, she met Mark Cross, a married design manager, and soon staged photographs of them emerged depicting them apparently engaged in sexual intercourse in a field. This was widely reported in the tabloid press.{{cite web|url=http://www.sundaymirror.co.uk/news/sunday/2007/05/27/katie-s-romps-with-married-man-no3-98487-19206463/|title=Katie romps with married man NO3|accessdate=2007-06-14|publisher=Sunday Mirror}} Hopkins married Cross in an episode of Celebrity Four Weddings alongside [[David Van Day]]'s wedding.[http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/showbiz/article-23802644-reality-tv-wedding-for-apprentice-maneater-katie-hopkins.do], additional text. Her son with Cross, Maximillian William, was born in November 2008.{{cite news |first=Linda |last=Nartey |title=Diet queen: How Apprentice villain Katie Hopkins got into her size 10 jeans just 10 days after having her third baby |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1162696/Diet-queen-How-Apprentice-star-Katie-Hopkins-got-size-10-jeans-just-10-days-having-baby.html |publisher=[[The Daily Mail]] |date=2009-03-18 |accessdate=2009-04-04 | location=London}}{{cite news |first=Linda |last=Nartey |title=Apprentice villain Katie Hopkins reveals she's pregnant with her third child |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1023789/Apprentice-villain-Katie-Hopkins-reveals-shes-pregnant-child.html |publisher=[[The Daily Mail]] |date=2008-06-04|accessdate=2008-08-24 | location=London}} ==''The Apprentice''== {{main|The Apprentice (UK Series Three)}} {{see also|The Apprentice (UK)}} In 2006, Hopkins was selected from over 10,000 people to be one of the final 16 candidates in series three of the reality TV show ''The Apprentice''.{{cite news|url=http://news.independent.co.uk/media/article2377690.ece|title=The sweet smell of success: Sugar's 'Apprentice' line-up|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=The Independent | location=London | first=Geneviève | last=Roberts | date=2007-03-21}} The opening episode of the series, broadcast on 28 March 2007, attracted over four million viewers.{{cite web|url=http://www.barb.co.uk/viewingsummary/weekreports.cfm?Requesttimeout=500&report=weeklyterrestrial|title=Weekly Viewing Summary-Terrestrial Top 30-BBC1-Week ending 01/04/2007|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=BARB}} She received particular media attention owing to her on-screen romantic relationship with fellow candidate Paul Callaghan – the first such relationship to feature on the show.{{cite web|url=http://theinternetforum.co.uk/node/2315|title=Apprentices in love|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=The Internet Forum}} She rejected [[Alan Sugar|Sir Alan Sugar]]'s offer of a place in the final episode of the programme, citing problems regarding [[childcare]] provision for her daughters, and withdrew from the competition at the end of the penultimate task.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/pages/live/articles/showbiz/showbiznews.html?in_article_id=460375&in_page_id=1773|title=Apprentice finalist reveals why she told Sir Alan: YOU'RE fired!|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=The Daily Mail | location=London | date=2007-06-08}} The episode pulled in 6.2 million viewers, while the following ''[[The Apprentice: You're Fired!|You're Fired]]!'' episode, in which Hopkins was interviewed, was watched by 3.1 million.{{cite news|url=http://media.guardian.co.uk/overnights/story/0,,2097470,00.html|title=The Apprentice beats Diana show|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=The Guardian | location=London | first=Leigh | last=Holmwood | date=2007-06-07}} (In fact, since Hopkins withdrew, she avoided being dismissed with Sugar's [[catch phrase]], "You're fired!".) However, despite her resigning on her own, Sir Alan later said in classic Sugar style that had she not resigned, he would have fired her anyway. Hopkins was the project manager of her team on ''The Apprentice'' for two tasks, in week two{{cite episode |title=Doggy Designs |episodelink=The Apprentice (UK Series Three) #Week 2: Doggy Designs |series=The Apprentice Series Three |serieslink=The Apprentice (UK Series Three) |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |airdate=2007-04-04 |season=3 |number=2}} and again in week nine.{{cite episode |title=Feeling the Strain |episodelink=The Apprentice (UK Series Three) #Week 9: Feeling the Strain |series=The Apprentice Series Three |serieslink=The Apprentice (UK Series Three) |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |airdate=2007-05-23 |season=3 |number=9}} Her team won both of these tasks. She was criticised by Sir Alan Sugar for being a "loser", due to her being on the losing team frequently.{{cite news |title=Sir Alan's blast to disgraced Apprentice Katie Hopkins: 'You're unemployable!'|url=http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/showbiz/article-23400566-details/Sir+Alan's+blast+to+disgraced+Apprentice+Katie+Hopkins:+'You're+unemployable!'/article.do |publisher=[[The Evening Standard]] |date=2007-06-14 |accessdate=2008-08-24}} She, however, defended herself by responding that whenever she led, her team won. Contestants [[Adam Hosker]] and [[Ghazal Asif]] brought Hopkins back to the "boardroom" in weeks seven and eight of the competition, both failing to get her fired.{{cite news |first=Nick |last=Levine |title='The Apprentice': Week 7 Recap |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/realitytv/a46309/the-apprentice-week-7-recap.html |publisher=[[Digital Spy]] |date=2007-05-10 |accessdate=2007-08-08 }}{{cite news |first=Nick |last=Levine |title='The Apprentice': Week 8 Recap |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/realitytv/a46701/the-apprentice-week-8-recap.html |publisher=[[Digital Spy]] |date=2007-05-17 |accessdate=2007-08-08 }} ===Comments and views=== Hopkins gained notoriety on the programme for her comments toward other contestants. These include calling [[Naomi Lay]] a "dog",{{cite web|url=http://www.newsoftheworld.co.uk/apprentice/news_030607_naomi4.shtml|title=Naomi: My sex video shame|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=News of the World}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} and wishing that fellow contestant [[Adam Hosker]] would get run over at the car salesroom in which he worked.{{cite web|url=http://www.newsoftheworld.co.uk/apprentice/news_100507_adam_fired.shtml|title=Sacked Adam turns on rival Katie|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=News of the World}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} Hopkins also derided fellow contestant [[Kristina Grimes]] by comparing her to a [[limpet]]{{cite web|url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/showbiz/realitytv/other/tm_method=full%26objectid=19030774%26siteid=89520-name_page.html|title=Kat Fight|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=The Mirror}} and mocking her fashion sense and use of [[fake tan]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/showbiz/latest/tm_headline=is-katie-the-biggest-bitch-on-tv-&method=full&objectid=19208874&siteid=89520-name_page.html|title=Is Katie the biggest bitch on TV?|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=The Mirror}} Hopkins also accused Grimes of trying to turn ''The Apprentice'' into "The Kristina Show"{{cite episode|title=[[The Apprentice (UK)|The Apprentice]]|station=[[BBC Two]]|airdate=30 May 2007|season=3|number=10}} and called her a "wench with a forked tongue".{{cite web|url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/topstories/tm_method=full%26objectid=19111320%26siteid=89520-name_page.html|title=Katie's in the red again|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=The Mirror}} Comments were aimed not just at her fellow contestants but also at viewers of television [[shopping channel]]s, [[maternity leave]],{{cite news|url=http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/tv_and_radio/article1894251.ece|title=Last night's TV|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=The Times | location=London | first=Tim | last=Teeman | date=2007-06-07}} the overweight{{cite news|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/tv_and_radio/story/0,,2096549,00.html|title=Call me crazy ... but doesn't Katie Hopkins deserve to be Sir Alan's Apprentice?|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=The Guardian | location=London | first=Grace | last=Dent | date=2007-06-06}} and people with the names [[Mavis]] and [[Derek]].{{cite episode|title=[[The Apprentice: You're Fired!]]|station=[[BBC Two]]|airdate=6 June 2007|season=3|number=11}} Although these comments might have been offensive to some, she insisted in her ''[[The Apprentice: You're Fired!|You're Fired!]]'' interview that it was only in the name of comedy, and suggested that she "just needed to vent a bit". ===Relationship with Paul Callaghan=== While filming ''The Apprentice'', Hopkins formed a relationship with fellow contestant [[List of The Apprentice candidates (UK)#Paul Callaghan|Paul Callaghan]]. Various conflicting reports emerged about whether the couple had sex whilst participating in the programme. Reports originally suggested that the couple had had sexual intercourse in the [[attic]] of the house in which the candidates were living,{{cite news|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/article/0,,2001320029-2007200462,00.html|title=Paul: You're fired, Katie|accessdate=06-14 2007|publisher=The Sun|location=London|date=2007-05-09}} though Callaghan vehemently denied this.{{cite web|url=http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/showbiz/article-23394836-details/Apprentice+show+flirting+'robbed+me+of+my+chance'/article.do|title=Apprentice show flirting 'robbed me of my chance'|accessdate=06-14 2007|publisher=This is London}} He later retracted his statement and confirmed that they had made love outdoors.{{cite web|url=http://www.newsoftheworld.co.uk/apprentice/news_030607_katie.shtml|title=I caught two-timing Katie bed-handed|accessdate=06-14 2007|publisher=News of the World|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20080612135702/http://www.newsoftheworld.co.uk/apprentice/news_030607_katie.shtml|archivedate=06-12 2008}} ===Response=== Hopkins emerged as a hate figure in the media, during her time on the programme. The [[tabloid journalism|tabloid]] press criticised her, comparing Hopkins to such fictional characters as [[Cruella De Vil]], [[Widow Twankey]], [[Darth Vader]], [[J.R. Ewing]], [[The Wicked Witch of the West]], [[Miss Piggy]], [[Catherine Tramell]] and [[Patrick Bateman]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/columnists/carroll/tm_method=full%26objectid=19217308%26siteid=89520-name_page.html|title=Katie Hopkins|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=The Mirror}}{{cite web|url=http://www.sundaymirror.co.uk/news/columnists/annasmith/tm_method=full%26objectid=19240387%26siteid=98487-name_page.html|title=How Henry thing goes!|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=The Sunday Mirror}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/columnists/parsons/tm_method=full%26objectid=19098458%26siteid=89520-name_page.html|title=Pearly Grates|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=The Mirror}}{{cite web|url=http://www.sundaymirror.co.uk/news/sunday/tm_method=full%26objectid=19238066%26siteid=98487-name_page.html|title=3 Out in Face-off|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=The Sunday Mirror}}{{cite news|first=Kevin|last=O’Sullivan|title=Gimme five|url=http://www.sundaymirror.co.uk/showbiz/tv/2007/06/10/gimme-five-98487-19275206/|publisher=Sunday Mirror|date=2007-06-10|accessdate=2007-07-23}}{{cite news|first=Janice|last=Turner|title=Katie Hopkins: captain of my bad-girl team|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/comment/columnists/janice_turner/article1907414.ece|publisher=The Times|date=2007-06-09|accessdate=2007-07-23 | location=London}} She has also been compared to real people, such as [[Ruth Badger]], [[Diana, Princess of Wales]], [[Simon Cowell]], [[Anne, Princess Royal|The Princess Royal]], [[Margaret Thatcher]] and [[Jade Goody]].{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/pages/live/articles/columnists/columnists.html?in_article_id=461037&in_page_id=1772&in_author_id=259&in_check=N|title=What will Apprentice villainess Katie Hopkins do next? Oh, tut, tut!|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=The Daily Mail | location=London | date=2007-06-10 | first=Suzanne | last=Moore}}{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/pages/live/articles/showbiz/showbiznews.html?in_article_id=462145&in_page_id=1773|title=Apprentice winner Simon: 'volcanic' Katie's the new Jade Goody|accessdate=06-16 2007|publisher=The Daily Mail | location=London | date=2007-06-15}} ''[[Four Weddings and a Funeral]]'' and ''[[Notting Hill (film)|Notting Hill]]'' writer [[Richard Curtis]] expressed his distaste for Hopkins, jokingly vowing to kill her when he accepted his Fellowship award at the [[British Academy Television Awards 2007|2007 BAFTA awards]].{{cite web |url=http://www.irishexaminer.com/breaking/story.asp?j=253874945&p=z5387576x&n=253875831|title=Casualty stuns soap rivals to net first BAFTA|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=Irish Examiner}} Her fellow contestants have questioned why she took part in the programme. [[Simon Ambrose]], a fellow contestant, told ''[[Nuts (magazine)|Nuts Magazine]]'' that he once "had a [[Limerence|crush]] on her",{{cite web|url=http://www.metro.co.uk/fame/article.html?in_article_id=53313&in_page_id=7&in_a_source=|title=Apprentice Simon had crush on Katie|accessdate=06-16 2007|publisher=Metro}} and also criticised Katie's much-publicised personal life as he came from a "[[wikt:broken home|broken home]]." Fellow contestant and rival Kristina Grimes said that Hopkins left the programme of her own accord as "she would have eventually got the axe." Ambrose also quoted Hopkins' friends' claim that her sole purpose in participating in the programme was to start a media career. Hopkins, like all other [[List of The Apprentice candidates (UK)|''Apprentice'' candidates]], appeared on the accompanying [[Spin-off (media)|spin-off programme]], ''The Apprentice: You're Fired!'', receiving a mixed response from the studio audience. When video clips of her comments about other candidates were shown, Hopkins explained that they were "quite funny". [[Michelle Mone]], the founder of [[lingerie]] company, [[Ultimo (lingerie)|Ultimo]] and a guest on the episode, verbally attacked Hopkins, calling her "exceptionally selfish" and made remarks such as "You've given [[businesswoman|businesswomen]] a bad name".{{cite web|url=http://www.dollymix.tv/2007/06/katie_quits_the_apprentice_in.html|title=Katie quits The Apprentice in a storm of maternal feelings... and her best quotes|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=Dolly Mix}} After this incident, Mone was dubbed the "bra woman" by the media.{{cite news|first=John|last=Plunkett|title=The Apprentice - series three, episode 11|url=http://blogs.guardian.co.uk/organgrinder/2007/06/the_apprentice_series_three_ep_10.html|publisher=The Guardian |date=2007-06-06|accessdate=2007-07-24 | location=London}} In the final episode of ''The Apprentice: You're Fired!'', Sir Alan branded Hopkins as sad and unemployable.{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/pages/live/articles/showbiz/showbiznews.html?in_article_id=461885&in_page_id=1773 |title=Sir Alan's blast to disgraced Apprentice Katie Hopkins: 'You're unemployable!' |accessdate=06-14 2007 |authorlink= |publisher=Daily Mail | location=London | date=2007-06-14}} Hopkins' comments on leaving the programme contained support for Simon Ambrose to win ''The Apprentice'', and revealed a desire to "smash a glass ceiling" over rival Kristina Grimes' head.{{cite news|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/article/0,,2001320029-2007260330,00.html|title=First time I've told a man 'no'|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=The Sun|location=London|date=2007-06-12}} ===Sexism controversy=== Sir Alan Sugar's questioning Hopkins about her [[childcare]] arrangements led to him being accused of sexism by the [[Trade Union Congress]], the [[Equal Opportunities Commission]] and the Recruitment and Employment Confederation.{{cite web |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/realitytv/a60107/sir-alan-sugar-accused-of-sexism.html |title=Sir Alan Sugar accused of sexism |accessdate=06-15 2007 |publisher=Digital Spy}} He was accused of violating the 1975 [[Sex Discrimination Act 1975|Sex Discrimination Act]].{{cite news |url=http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/tv_and_radio/article1901452.ece |title=Sugar faces sexism row as ex-Apprentice sells story |accessdate=06-15 2007 |publisher=The Times | location=London | date=2007-06-08 | first=Adam | last=Sherwin}} This incident created a huge controversy and was well documented in the media.{{cite news|url=http://business.guardian.co.uk/comment/story/0,,2098403,00.html|title=All fired up|accessdate=06-15 2007 |publisher=The Guardian | location=London | date=2007-06-08}}{{cite web |url=http://www.theherald.co.uk/features/features/display.var.1456687.0.0.php|title=Katie gone at last, but was the firing squad fair?|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=The Herald}}{{cite web|url=http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/entertainment/film-tv/news/article2633484.ece|title=Sugar accused of sexism after apprentice quits|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=The Belfast Telegraph}}{{cite web|url=http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/showbiz/article-23399689-details/Sir+Alan+accused+of+sexism+towards+Apprentice+villain+Katie/article.do|title=Sir Alan accused of sexism towards Apprentice villain Katie|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=This is London}} Sir Alan argued his case in an interview with [[GMTV]] host Fiona Phillips, stating that he was well aware of the rules.{{cite episode|title=Sir Alan Sugar Interview|series=[[GMTV]]|station=[[ITV1]]|airdate=13 June 2007|season=14}} ==Aftermath== After her appearance on ''The Apprentice'', Hopkins signed two exclusive deals to sell her story: a newspaper deal with the ''[[News of the World]]'' and a magazine deal with [[EMAP]], the company behind [[heat (magazine)|''Heat'']] and ''[[Grazia]]'' magazines.{{cite news|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/uk_news/story/0,,2097757,00.html|title=Apprentice star signs News of the World deal|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=The Guardian | location=London | first=Leigh | last=Holmwood | date=2007-06-07}} In her ''News of the World'' interview, Hopkins played down media reports that she had broken marriages, but did reveal that she had had ten lovers and had sex with a man in the [[barracks]] at The Royal Military Academy, Sandhurst.{{cite web |url=http://www.newsoftheworld.co.uk/apprentice/news_1006_katie.shtml|title=I’m 10 out of 10 in bed!|accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=The News of the World}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} She told the paper that Michelle Mone, who had verbally attacked her on ''The Apprentice: You’re Fired!'', was probably "just happy to be out of the underwear factory for the day".{{cite web |url=http://www.newsoftheworld.co.uk/videoplayer/videoshowbiz.php?videoid=http://del.interoute.com/?id=96d28f0a-76d2-47be-9efd-ea770c8ff1b7&delivery=stream# |title=Apprentice Katie gives her straight video verdict on Michelle from You're Fired |accessdate=06-15 2007 |publisher=The News of the World}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} She also told the paper that she lost her virginity aged 17 after leaving a convent school and that she hopes to be a [[Member of Parliament]] for the [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative Party]], like [[Margaret Thatcher]]. The day after Hopkins' final ''Apprentice'' episode aired, two prominent news stories emerged about her; [[stepdaughter]] Charlotte McKinney told the ''[[Daily Mail]]'' that Hopkins had ruined her family and driven the teenager to anorexia by sending her cards with stick men drawn on them,{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/pages/live/articles/showbiz/showbiznews.html?in_article_id=460026&in_page_id=1773 |title=Apprentice Katie Hopkins 'wrecked my family' |accessdate=06-15 2007 |publisher=Daily Mail | location=London | date=2007-06-07}} and another ''Mail'' article reported that fans of the programme were accusing the [[BBC]] of fixing her walk-out.{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/pages/live/articles/showbiz/showbiznews.html?in_article_id=460375&in_page_id=1773 |title=Apprentice fans accuse the BBC of rigging Katie's walkout |accessdate=06-15 2007 |publisher=The Daily Mail | location=London | date=2007-06-08}} Hopkins revealed in an interview with [[BBC Radio Kent]] that she had great respect for Sir Alan Sugar, and that she believed she would have won the programme had she been in the final episode. She also said that the media's attitudes towards her did not affect her, but did affect her family.{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/kent/realmedia/audio/kents_best/thursday.ram|title=Katie Hopkins BBC Radio Kent Interview |accessdate=06-15 2007|publisher=BBC Radio Kent}} When talking to [[Fiona Phillips]] in an interview aired on ''[[GMTV Today]]'' on the morning of the final ''Apprentice''
